Conformance Criteria - Engineer to assess foundation material suitability

○ Hold point when excavation is at level

Conformance Criteria - Granular backfill to be placed in layers of maximum 200mm and compacted in accordance with NZS4431:2022 with appropriate on-site quality control. Fill should be placed on dry subgrade.
Inspection / Test Method submission, visual inspection, testing, measure, review - Testing
Conformance Criteria - A Target dry density at optimum water content of at least 95% should be achieved in accordance with NZS 4402:1986, Test 4.1.1.
○ 5 x Clegg hammer readings shall be taken for each terramesh unit lift of 0.6m with the addition of 5 x NDM tests evey 1.2m lift (i.e every second terramesh unit)
○ NDM Testing to be carried out by IANZ accredited lab and results witnessed by CPS Engineer as they become available
Records - Clegg and NDM test reports, Clegg calibration certificate

Conformance Criteria - Grids are cut to the length stated in drawings. Grids are placed in the right direction (high tensile strength perpendicular to face), Grids are overlapped (see manufacturer's spec of the specific grid/fabric), laid flat and undamaged.
